description:
This is a design + WordPress build role. No custom dev required.

About EWS

We build websites for schools and education institutions across Australia. Small team, growing fast, looking for someone who can design clean sites and actually ship them.

If you want to learn quickly, take on real work early, and grow with a company that's scaling, this could be a good fit.

The Role

We want someone driven to work in a fast paced company. You'll be designing and building WordPress sites in Divi (we can train you if you've used other builders like Elementor or Gutenberg).

This is design first. We care about your eye for layout, typography, spacing and polish more than your coding ability.

The work is structured enough to learn from but varied enough to stay interesting. You'll work directly with the team, get feedback fast, and see your work go live.

No custom plugin/theme development required. We would prefer a Graphic Designer than a Web Developer.

In-office (Mansfield Park, SA) to start so you can learn quickly. Remote flexibility once you're running independently.

What You'll Do

Design and build WordPress websites using Divi

Create layouts, update content, publish pages

Prepare web assets (banners, images, graphics)

Handle responsive design and fix layout issues

Work from briefs and follow brand guidelines

QA your work before it goes live

Who We're Looking For

Experience level doesn't matter much. How you work does.

You might be a recent design grad, a graphic designer wanting to build more websites, or a junior designer ready to level up in a growing company.

What matters:

Strong design fundamentals (layout, typography, spacing, visual hierarchy)

Comfortable with WordPress (uni projects, side work, personal sites all count)

You communicate well and take feedback

You finish things instead of endlessly tweaking them

Portfolio required (link or PDF)

Nice to Have

Divi experience

Basic HTML/CSS experience

Photoshop and Illustrator experience

Basic SEO understanding

Details

Hours: 15-30+ per week, flexible. Can grow to full-time.

Pay: Based on experience
Permanent: $28-$34/hour + super
Casual: $35-$42/hour + super

Apply

Send your CV, portfolio, and a quick note about your WordPress experience (what builders you've used).

If you've got design skills and you're ready to build real work, let's talk.
